result.execSummary:
The defendant John R. Umbs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
** 8 DAYS CREDIT IF REVOKED**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

defendant.name: Umbs, John R.
defendant.address: 843 N Hastings Way, Eau Claire, WI 54703

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

Cases called at 11:31 AM: 22CT187, 20CF1358, 21CM1002, 21CT59, 22CF286, 22CM113.
Defendant John R. Umbs in court with Attorney David W. Field.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Agreement has been reached. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
20CF1358: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine; Repeater. Repeater acknowledged.
22CF286: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Felony Bail Jumping.
22CM113: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1: Operate Motor Vehicle While Revoked.
Court accepts the pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Sentence is Withheld and the Defendant is placed on 2 Years of Probation (on the felonies only) with the following conditions:
AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Court Costs/surcharges including one warrant fee in 20CF1358. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
22CM113: Defendant is sentenced to Court Costs/surcharges, DNA sample/surcharge.
Defendant is granted 4 days of sentence credit in 20CF1358 and 8 days of credit in 22CF286.
Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Cases called at 9:44 AM: 20CF1358, 21CM1002, 21CT59, 22CF286, 22CM113.
Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John R. Umbs in court with Attorney David W. Field.
Defendant waives his right to Preliminary Hearings in 20CF1358 and 22CF286.
Branch 2 to schedule further proceedings.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
(Covers 22CM113, 21CT59, 21CM1002, 20CF1358, 22CF286)

(Cases 22CF286, 22CM113, 21CT59, 21CM1002, 20CF1358 are called at 11:12 AM- by Zoom) Defendant John Umbs appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants executed in 22CM113, 21CT59, 21CM1002, 20CF1358. Defense waives reading of the Complaint in 22CF286. State requests $250 cash bond to cover all 5 cases. Defense requests lower cash bond. Court orders $200 cash bond to cover all 5 cases with various conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived in 22CF286. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 03/23/2022 at 2:30 PM.  Hearing: 04/19/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
(Covers 22CM113, 21CT59, 21CM1002, 20CF1358, 22CF286)
